result.execSummary:
The defendant Dustin L. Bemowski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Contact after Domestic Abuse Arrest [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 968.075(5)(a)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department.

Clerk Marisa. 
Case Called: 8:36 am 
INCLUDES 15CF986 AND 15CM2394. 
State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo; Def appears in person with Atty Jay Kronenwetter.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. VRCW. 

State moves to: 
In 15CF986: Ct. 1 (Battery/DA/DA Repeater/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
                    : Ct. 2 (Battery/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
                    : Ct. 3 (Criminal Damage to Property/DA/DA Repeater/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
In 15CM2394: Ct. 2 (Contact after DA Arrest/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
COURT grants above. 

PLEA: 
In 15CF986: Ct. 4 (DC/DA/DA Repeater/Repeater)>>GUILTY. 
                    : Ct. 5 (Criminal Trespass to Dwelling/DA/DA Repeater/Repeater)>>GUILTY. 
In 15CM2394: Ct. 1 (Contact after DA Arrest/Repeater)>>GUILTY. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 
Def makes statement. 

COURT ORDERS: 
In 15CF986: Ct. 4>>4 yrs imprisonment - 3 yrs IC & 1 yr ES - imposed & STAYED for 4 years probation. 
                    : Ct. 5>>4 yrs imprisonment - 3 yrs IC & 1 yr ES - imposed & STAYED for 4 years probation - CONDITION of probation on this count only>>60 days MCJ & 30 hours CS imposed & STAYED for rule violations. 
In 15CM2394: Ct. 1>>2 yrs imprisonment - 1 yr IC & 1 yr ES - imposed & STAYED for 1 year probation. 

COURT ORDERS as CONDITIONS of Probation on ALL>>assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; contact with victim only if allowed by agent; CC including 2 DA surcharges & DNA surcharge (sample already on file). 
COURT finds the def entitled to NO days jail credit - parties may file written stipulation re: credit at a later date if necessary. 
COURT ORDERS all sentences to run CONCURRENT to each other. 
COURT finds the def eligible for CIP or SAP. 
Probation Review Hrg set for July 27, 2018 at 1:15 pm in Br. 3 in 15CF986. 

Adj: 9:05 am
Motion hearing on May 31, 2018 at 03:30 pm.

Clerk Marisa.
